FuncDef:
The link-protocol transport command enables transparent transmission of packets of the Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP), operation, administration and maintenance (OAM), Ethernet Synchronization Messaging Channel Protocol (ESMC), and Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).
The undo link-protocol transport command disables transparent transmission of LACP, OAM, ESMC, and LLDP protocol packets.
By default, transparent transmission of LACP, OAM, ESMC, and LLDP protocol packets is disabled in the slot view.
CLIs: link-protocol transport { lldp | lacp | oam | esmc }
undo link-protocol transport { lldp | lacp | oam | esmc }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables transparent transmission of LLDP protocol packets.
-

Enables or disables transparent transmission of LACP protocol packets.
-

Enables or disables transparent transmission of OAM (802.3ah) protocol packets.
-

Enables or disables transparent transmission of ESMC protocol packets.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If LLDP, LACP, OAM, or ESMC is enabled on the device, to enable a device to transparently transmit tagged LLDP, LACP, OAM, or ESMC protocol packets, run the link-protocol transport command in the slot view.
